title: Apport
data:
- *Not to be confused with [tameness](/wiki/Tameness "Tameness").*

In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, **apport** is a statistic that represents how likely a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is to 'fetch' items and bring them to [you](/wiki/You "You").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Etymology](#Etymology)
- [4 See also](#See_also)
- [5 References](#References)

## Description

"Apport" is the name of a variable field in `struct edog` that governs the chances of a pet picking up an item and dropping it on a square next to you.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) The higher the apport stat is, the more likely a pet is to bring you an item.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) New pets start with an apport equal to your current [charisma](/wiki/Charisma "Charisma").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Apport can be increased by feeding your pet any [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that qualifies as a [treat](/wiki/Treat "Treat") shortly after it has dropped an item near you. While this is commonly done by throwing the treat to the pet, the only requirement for treats to increase apport is that it has been in your inventory previously.

Apport is decremented by 1 each time the pet drops an item, to a minimum of 1.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

The exact formula for apport gain (calculated when the pet receives a treat) is:[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

```
200 / ((distance from you to pet when the last item was dropped) + (# of turns since item was dropped))
```

Ideally, if a pet drops an item right next to you, and you immediately throw it a treat, the calculation would be:

```
200 / (1 square + 1 turn) =  200/2  = +100 apport
```

## Strategy

Apport is best raised and maintained by immediately rewarding a pet for dropping an item at your feet; this will raise initial apport high enough for the pet to start seeking you out, after which you should treat your pet from time to time after it drops something to keep apport high. [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") start with a [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony") and many [carrots](/wiki/Carrot "Carrot") and [apples](/wiki/Apple "Apple"), and [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") can turn [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock") into [meatballs](/wiki/Meatball "Meatball") via [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh"), making them the most immediately prepared roles to handle this kind of training. Training apport is also a solid method of preparing a pet to [steal from shops](/wiki/Stealing_from_shops "Stealing from shops").

## Etymology

The term "apport" is derived from the archaic English word "[apporter](http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/apporter "wiktionary:apporter")" and the much more common French *apporter* of the same spelling; their common root is the Latin *apportō* (“I carry in”). The former refers to an importer, while the latter is a verb that can mean "to bring (in)".

In many languages, "apport" is a widely used command in dog training, equivalent to "fetch".[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

## See also

- Eva Myers' excellent spoiler for [Keeping and Training Pets in NetHack and SLASH'EM](https://sites.google.com/view/evasroguelikegamessite/keeping-and-training-pets-in-nethack-and-slashem)
- [Tameness](/wiki/Tameness "Tameness")
- [Monster carrying capacity](/wiki/Monster_carrying_capacity "Monster carrying capacity")
